thread.title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Bank Deregulation, College Loans, Fried Chicken - MoneyBeat - WSJ

author: Dwight Oestricher
title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Bank Deregulation, College Loans, Fried Chicken - MoneyBeat - WSJ
text: The financial-deregulation bill passed by the U.S. Congress this week is the latest phase in the eternal tug-of-war between regulators and banks. As fast as governments impose limits on the financial industry, banks, brokers and other firms fight back, writes Jason Zweig. It’s been happening for millennia, and it probably will keep happening until the WSJ City: The Early Winner from Italy's Political Chaos, U.S. Jeopardizes Trade Talks with China Next U.S.-China Trade Talks Teeter on the Edge—Energy Journal
